qas.question: Who wrote "The Cruise of the Steam Yacht North Star"?
What town did Choules say had the only Main Street more beautiful than Southampton's?
How long was Southampton's High Street as described by Choules?
What adjective did Choules use to describe the shops of Southampton's High Street?
Choules complimented the streets of Southampton for being kept in what condition?

context: In his 1854 book "The Cruise of the Steam Yacht North Star" <a0_0>John Choules<a0_0/> described Southampton thus: "I hardly know a town that can show a more beautiful Main Street than Southampton, except it be <a1_0>Oxford<a1_0/>. The High Street opens from the quay, and under various names it winds in a gently sweeping line for <a2_0>one mile and a half<a2_0/>, and is of very handsome width. The variety of style and color of material in the buildings affords an exhibition of outline, light and color, that I think is seldom equalled. The shops are very <a3_0>elegant<a3_0/>, and the streets are kept exceedingly <a4_0>clean<a4_0/>."
